head.title: Sydney F. Cruice, Terence A. Dixon

hedline.hl1: Sydney F. Cruice, Terence A. Dixon

block.p: Sydney Fielding Cruice, a daughter of Mrs. John M. Cruice Jr. of Wynnewood, Pa., and the late Mr. Cruice, was married yesterday to Terence Alexander Dixon, the son of Dr. Sylvia J. Finley and Dr. Victor F. Dixon of Dublin. The Rev. James M. Taylor performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Philadelphia.

Mrs. Dixon, 37, is a senior manager in the consumer lending marketing department at American Express Travel Related Services in New York. She graduated from Pennsylvania State University and received an M.B.A. from Drexel University. Her father was an independent real estate broker in Philadelphia. Her mother, Mathilde Cruice, is a broker at Roche Wheeler, a real estate agency in Newtown Square, Pa.

Sydney Fielding Cruice, a daughter of Mrs. John M. Cruice Jr. of Wynnewood, Pa., and the late Mr. Cruice, was married yesterday to Terence Alexander Dixon, the son of Dr. Sylvia J. Finley and Dr. Victor F. Dixon of Dublin. The Rev. James M. Taylor performed the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Philadelphia.

Mrs. Dixon, 37, is a senior manager in the consumer lending marketing department at American Express Travel Related Services in New York. She graduated from Pennsylvania State University and received an M.B.A. from Drexel University. Her father was an independent real estate broker in Philadelphia. Her mother, Mathilde Cruice, is a broker at Roche Wheeler, a real estate agency in Newtown Square, Pa.

Mr. Dixon, 30, is an associate at Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, the New York law firm. He graduated from Trinity College in Dublin and received his law degree from Columbia University. His mother is a psychiatrist in Dublin. His father is a professor and heads the department of Spanish and Portuguese at Trinity College. WEDDINGS
